#labels Featured

= Prerequisites =

The following dependencies are required:
 * Java 6
 * Eclipse 3.5 or higher
 * EMF 2.5 or higher

EMF4SW Toolkit also requires the following dependency:
 * ATL 3.1 or higher
 
EMF Triple requires the following dependencies:
 * EclipseLink JPA 2.1.0 or higher
 * Xtext 1.0 or higher

= Install for Eclipse 3.6 =

Installation for Eclipse 3.6 can be easily done via the update manager. Go to Help -> Install New Software... menu and add this 
update site http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/emftriple/. Select this site in the menu list, and you should see the available 
plugins just as in the following picture. You can now select the plugins you want. If you are interested by model transformations from Ecore/UML to 
OWL/RDF then select Eclipse Modeling for Semantic Web. If you are interested by the RDF Storage and Querying solution for the Eclipse Modeling Framework then select EMF Triple. 

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/updatesite.jpg" height="640"/>

Once you selected the desired plugins, click next, you should now see the list of plugins that will be install. Click Next to proceed.

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/install.jpg" height="640"/>

Before proceed to the installation you should accept the terms and license agreements. Click Finish to install.

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/accept.jpg" height="640"/>

= Install for Eclipse 3.5 =

Installation for Eclipse 3.5 can be done via the update site manager, but requires adding some necessary update sites not available by default. Adding 
update sites can be done via the Add button in the update manager. Like depicted in the following picture. 

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/add.jpg" height="640"/>

The update sites that needs to be added are the following ones:
 * http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/m2m/updates/milestones/ => for ATL 3.1.0
 * http://download.itemis.com/updates/milestones => for Xtext 1.0.0
 * http://download.eclipse.org/rt/eclipselink/milestone-updates => JPA 2.0
 
 * http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/emftriple/ => EMF4SW and EMF Triple
 
Once you have added those update sites you can proceed to the installation procedure explained in previous section. Select EMF Triple update site from the menu list, and choose the desired plugins.

= Install from Eclipse Marketplace Client =

[www.eclipse.org/mpc/ Eclipse Marketplace client] is a rich client solution for installing solutions listed on Eclipse Marketplace directly from an Eclipse Installation. Since EMF Triple is listed in Eclipse marketplace, you can use the marketplace client to install EMF Triple.

The Eclipse Marketplace client is available in the Help -> Eclipse Marketplace... menu. If this menu is not available then you can install the marketplace client thanks to the update manager (this works for eclipse 3.6). As depicted by the following pictures, the marketplace client is 
available from the General Purpose Tools category in the Helios repository.

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/mpc.jpg" height="640"/>

Once tou have install the marketplace client you can try to search for EMF Triple. When you find it, click install to proceed to the installation.

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/selectemftriple.jpg" height="640"/>

= Install from Source =

Installation from source can be done once the following dependencies are installed:
 * EMF SDK see http://wiki.eclipse.org/EMF/Installation
 * Xtext 1.0.0 via update site: http://download.itemis.com/updates/milestones (only for EMF Triple)
 * JPA 2.0 via update site: http://download.eclipse.org/rt/eclipselink/milestone-updates (only for EMF Triple)
 * ATL 3.1 via update site: http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/m2m/updates/milestones/ (only for EMF4SW)
 * ATL Commons via update site: http://atl-commons.googlecode.com/hg/atl-commons/ (only for EMF4SW)
 
Once all those dependencies are satisfied you can checkout the source code via the googlecode SVN repository. If you have a SVN client installed under your Eclipse environment, go to SVN Repository perspective, and add a new repository location with for url https://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ and username anonymous.

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/svn.jpg" height="640"/>

You can now checkout the trunk repository to get the latest version of the software.

<img src="http://emftriple.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/checkout.jpg" height="640"/>
